intro: Isolepis hookeriana var. elatior, commonly known as the tall spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. This variant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist to waterlogged soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland ecosystems and ecological studies.
